sub_title: Independent curator and project manager exhibitions and other projects in the field of art and cultural heritage
summary:
All round museum professional, experienced in working within cultural organizations as well as in operating independently.

Previously (2018-2023)
Head Curators and Library Museum Catharijneconvent, Utrecht.

Previously (2008-2015)
Head of Collections at the Museum of Friesland and subsequently also at the Fries Verzetsmuseum and Keramiekmuseum Princessehof / Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics. My responsibilities where: collection development and research; concept and content development; project management; collection management; representing the museum in the media and at events.
As a member of the management team I participated in reinventing the concept, key values and storytelling for the renewed Fries Museum, which reopened in its new and state of the art building September 2013.

The Museum of Friesland was awarded the BankGiro Loterij Museumprijs 2015 / Dutch Museum Award 2015.

Selection of commissions:
Exhibition Director, concept and content development of the exhibition, publication and film programme 'Lawrence Alma-Tadema: Classical Charm'. Exhibition tour: Museum of Friesland, Leeuwarden, Belvedere Museum Vienna, Leighton House museum, London (2016-2017).
Awarded the Turing Toekenning I 2015 (biennial award for the best exhibition plan in a Dutch museum).
Finalist Global Fine Art Award 2017, winner YOU-2 Award 2017 (popular vote).
Our expert team comprised scholars and experts from The Netherlands, U.K., U.S.A., Belgium and Austria.

Project management, concept & content development, development phase of new permanent collection, Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics, Leeuwarden (2015-2016).

Domaine Lescure, France. Advise and historical research into gardens and buildings on the site and participation in developing a masterplan for the domain (2016-2018).

Directing production of an exhibition catalogue on M.C. Escher, Museum of Friesland (Leeuwarden European Capital of Culture 2018).

treasury_media.title: Volkskrant: regionale musea & Alma-Tadema
treasury_media.description: De regiomusea toonden in 2016 veel mooie exposities. Hoe klein zijn grote voordelen heeft.

treasury_media.title: The Alma-Tadema exhibition was awarded 'De Turing Toekenning I 2015'
treasury_media.description: De Turing Foundation wil Nederlandse musea helpen om hun ambitieniveau te verhogen, en het financieel mogelijk maken om tentoonstellingen te organiseren met kunstwerken die anders alleen in buitenlandse musea te zien zijn.

profile_positions.description: Advies, opzet en redactie van een visie voor de buitenruimtes en tuinen van het museum voor de herinrichting en nieuwbouw van het museum. In aanvulling op de eerdere Visie architectuur, vormgeving en ruimtelijke ordening. (2021, i.s.m. architect Siebe Tettero).

profile_positions.description: Begeleiding, opzet en redactie van nieuw collectiebeleid en een nieuw collectieplan voor het museum.

profile_positions.title: Coordinator production exhibition catalogue on M.C. Escher

profile_positions.description:
Exhibition Director, concept & content development

“The appropriately epic exhibition of the work of Lawrence Alma-Tadema […] is one of the largest ever held.” (The Guardian)

Awarded the 'Turing Toekenning I 2015' (biennial award for best exhibition concept in a Dutch Museum) (http://www.turingfoundation.org/toekenning15.html)
Finalist Global Fine Art Award 2017

The exhibition toured from October 2016 through October 2017:
Fries Museum, Leeuwarden
Belvedere Wien
Leighton House Museum, London

Exhibition and accompanying publication focus on the way Alma-Tadema used his theatrically designed house and studio as a laboratory for his paintings which depict life in ancient Roman times.
His paintings are begging to be brought to life. Around 1910 they functioned as blue prints for the new mass medium of cinema in Hollywood, and later Cinecittà. Today, although we do not realize it, our image of ancient Rome is in a way based on scenes presented in Alma-Tadema's paintings.

Exhibition design: Paul Toornend / Graphic design: Michaël Snitker / film projections: Studio Louter
Leeuwarden, Vienna and London each customized their displays to meet the expectations of their audiences.

In cooperation with international researchers on cinema, theatre, art history, (reception of) archaeology and with Hollywood production designer Arthur Max (Gladiator [2000], Exodus: Gods and Kings [2014]), and many others.

The accompanying publication (Fries Museum / Prestel / WBOOKS, Dutch, English, German language editions) was written by leading international researchers and experts.
The children's book, 'Wonen in een schilderij' (2016) is written by  Lida Dijkstra (Dutch and Frisian editions only).

Accompanying Film programme with classic block busters like Gli Ultimi Giorni di Pompei, Ben Hur, Gladiator, Exodus: Gods and Kings, etc. Some early films were introduced by experts and accompanied by live music.
profile_positions.title: Independent Exhibition Director 'Lawrence Alma-Tadema', for the Museum of Friesland

profile_positions.description:
Exhibition projects at the Frisian Museum (selection):
-Programme for the renewed Fries Museum (2013) Dutch Museum Award 2015
Co-responsibility interior design new building and concepts programme new museum
-Oud Geld. Ons kent ons in de Gouden Eeuw (2013 through 2016)
On art treasures, must haves and old boys networks in the Dutch Golden Age. On things, people and stories the visitor of today can relate to.
Project management and concept
In cooperation with leading experts, among whom: Jort Kelder (advice and filmclip) and Menno Landstra, ex editor in chief Quote magazine (concept and exhibition design)
-Hindelooper Kamer (2013-2016)
Presentation of historical interior together with 'Hindelooper thriller' by artist John Bock
In cooperation with performer, video artist and internationally acclaimed 'mad inventor' John Bock (Germany 1965) and various researchers in the field of cultural history
profile_positions.title: Exhibition projects (selection)

profile_positions.description:
Three museums, one back office:
-Frisian Museum (2008-2015) / www.friesmuseum.nl
-National Ceramics Museum Princessehof (2013-2015) / www.princessehof.nl
-Frisian Resistance Museum (2013-2015) / www.friesverzetsmuseum.nl

Full time Head of Collections at the Museum of Friesland and subsequently also at the Frisian Resistance Museum / Fries Verzetsmuseum and Keramiekmuseum Princessehof / Princessehof National Museum of Ceramics. My responsibilities where: collection development and research; concept and content development; project management; collection management; representing the museum in the media and at events.
As a member of the management team I participated in reinventing the concept, key values and storytelling for the renewed Fries Museum, which reopened in its new and state of the art building September 2013.

The Museum of Friesland was awarded the BankGiro Loterij Museumprijs 2015 / Dutch Museum Award 2015.
